item.title: Minecraft Player Shows Off Impressive Natural Cave They Found While Exploring
item.description:
Highlights

  • Minecraft's Caves & Cliffs update revamped world generation, making caves grander and more expansive than ever before.
  • A Reddit user shared coordinates to an impressive cave in their survival world, showcasing the game's natural beauty.
  • The update brought significant enhancements to procedural generation, showcasing Mojang's continuous improvements to the game.

An avid Minecraft player shows off some images of an incredible cave they found when exploring their primary survival mode world. In recent years, Mojang has made several significant enhancements to the procedural generation in Minecraft , meaning that fans are discovering more impressive natural structures in the game than ever before. This cave in particular exemplifies these improvements perfectly.

Mojang's massively popular sandbox survival game has received overhaul after overhaul since its 2009 inception. Some of Minecraft 's best updates over the years were the ones that brought key upgrades to the foundations of the game, like 2016's Combat Update, 2019's Village & Pillage update, and 2020's Nether Update. However, as exciting as these were, none of them shook Minecraft 's world to its very core like 2021's Caves & Cliffs update did, and quite literally at that. The aptly-named two-part update revamped the way caves were generated in the game by making them grander and more expansive. One player, in fact, decided to take some screenshots to show off just how impressive the changes made in Caves & Cliffs were.

Related
Minecraft Fan Reveals Awesome Mob Concept Based on the Game’s Squids

One of Minecraft's most divisive mobs gets a massive upgrade in some slightly creepy fanart that'll make anyone afraid of the ocean.

A Reddit user by the name of Ok_Figure_4181 made a post on the r/Minecraft subreddit, asking fans to share their discoveries of impressive procedurally generated worlds in the game that blew them away when they first saw them. To get the conversation rolling, the Redditor provided some images of their own, showcasing a stunning cave they found in their "main survival world," right after Caves & Cliffs: Part 2 came out. The massive, dimly-lit cave in question was generated beside a lake and had what resembled an eerie pillar of sorts in the center of it, making it seem like it was almost hand-crafted.

The screenshots of the cave have direct coordinates pointing toward its exact location on the map, meaning that players who use the seed 1571309911 will be able to visit and explore the naturally-generated structure for themselves. However, there's a catch. According to Ok_Figure_4181, this world of theirs was created in an older version of Minecraft 's Bedrock Edition . Given that it isn't easy to downgrade to older, non-Java versions of Minecraft , it's possible that the world this impressive cave is in will be lost to time in the future. Fortunately, though, this seed still seems to work on current versions of the game.

The Caves & Cliffs Update Took Procedural Generation in Minecraft to the Next Level

A few years ago, the majority of Minecraft 's caves weren't that interesting to look at. Players often found themselves in caves that were not only static in layout, but also lacking in width and depth. Luckily, the Caves & Cliffs update really improved the world generation in the game, as is evident by the impressive natural structures that Minecraft fans have recently been discovering and sharing on social media.

item.title: Destiny 2 Fan Shares Awesome Exotic Weapon Concept Based on Flintlock Pistols
item.description:
Highlights

  • Destiny 2 fans are loving the exotic weapon design inspired by flintlock pistols shared by a player.
  • Exotic hand cannons like "The Quartermaster" are highly valued for their versatility and firepower in gameplay.
  • Bungie is offering free access to Destiny 2 expansions, gearing players up for The Final Shape expansion.

Destiny 2 fans are abuzz with excitement as a player shares a captivating exotic weapon design inspired by flintlock pistols. Destiny 2 , developed by Bungie, is an online multiplayer first-person shooter game. Set in a sprawling sci-fi universe, players assume the roles of Guardians, tasked with defending humanity against various alien threats. The game offers a rich tapestry of PvE and PvP activities, including story-driven campaigns, challenging raids, intense Crucible matches, and expansive open-world exploration.

Fans of Destiny 2 are always eager for new content, especially when it comes to exotic weapons. These rare and powerful firearms often become the centerpiece of players' arsenals, shaping their gameplay experiences and strategies. Exotic hand cannons in Destiny 2 are popular weapon choices among Guardians for their versatility and firepower. These powerful firearms deliver high damage per shot, making them effective for both close-quarters combat and ranged engagements.

Related
Destiny 2 Making Exciting Change to Stasis Subclass

Destiny 2 developer Bungie confirms a change to the Stasis subclass that's creating a lot of excitement in the player community.

Destiny 2 Player Designs Exotic Hand Cannon

Reddit user Yugledude recently shared his concept for "The Quartermaster," an exotic hand cannon designed to evoke the style and functionality of flintlock pistols. The weapon would deliver devastating one-tap headshots or require two body shots in Crucible matches. Additionally, it features a unique perk called "Loose Change," which provides bonuses such as increased reload speed, aim assist, and faster movement while aiming down sights.

The concept has sparked enthusiastic discussion within the Destiny 2 community, with players praising the creativity and ingenuity behind "The Quartermaster." Some have expressed excitement at the prospect of wielding such a distinctive and powerful weapon in the game, while others have offered suggestions for additional exotic hand cannons with different elemental alignments. Destiny 2 fans are now being offered a golden opportunity to dive deeper into the game's expansions, as Bungie is providing temporary free access to several Destiny 2 expansions . With Shadowkeep, Beyond Light, and The Witch Queen up for grabs until June 3, players have ample time to get themselves acquainted with the new subclasses, gear, and seasonal content, all in anticipation of The Final Shape expansion slated for release in June.

Destiny 2 players are in for a treat with the upcoming Final Shape expansion, as Bungie revealed customizable exotic class items. Amid the excitement surrounding this major update, Destiny 2 revealed different perks available for Hunters , Titans, and Warlocks. Players can mix and match these perks, with the Prismatic subclass serving as the gateway to these exotic class items.

As Destiny 2 gears up for The Final Shape expansion, Bungie remains committed to refining and enriching the game's content, ensuring an engaging and polished experience for Guardians across the galaxy. Destiny 2 received a major update with the release of version 7.3.6.3, addressing various issues and implementing tweaks across the game. Notably, the update resolves issues in the Onslaught mode, rectifies weapon adjustments for favorites like Recluse and Hammerhead, and eliminates prominent cheese spots within The Whisper mission.

item.title: Call of Duty Zombies Fan Makes Adorable Speed Cola Model Out of Wood
item.description:
Highlights

  • Attention to detail shines in a CoD Zombies fan's miniature Speed Cola vending machine model, which is true to the game's design.
  • Limon426's post on Reddit received praise for its accuracy, sparking requests for more game-related models.
  • Nostalgia for classic Call of Duty Zombies modes is common, ensuring that many fans appreciated the handcrafted creation.

"Adorable" is not a word that would describe many things in Call of Duty 's violent and gory "Zombies" mode, but one fan's miniature recreation of the Speed Cola vending machine item may be a rare exception. Standing at only a few inches high, the wood model is a replica of the in-game vending machine that first appeared in Call of Duty : World at War 's "Nazi Zombies" spin-off mode.

The model, which the fan made in a workshop at one of their classes at school, is surprisingly accurate for its size, featuring not just the Speed Cola logo, but elevated vending buttons and a coin slot to give it some more dimension. They also made it appear dirty and slightly damaged to add to the authentic, worn-out look, further replicating its appearance from the game.

Related
Call of Duty: 16 Hardest Zombies Maps

The Call of Duty franchise has plenty of challenging zombie maps that will test the survival skills of players across a variety of locations.

Attention to Detail Shines Through in This Mini Speed Cola Machine

In their original post from the main Call of Duty: Zombies subreddit, Reddit user Limon426 shared an image of themselves holding the model, showing just how small it really is, as they can easily hold it in one hand. Other users were quick to praise the fan's work, complimenting how realistic the Perk machine looked, with some asking the user to make more models of some of CoD Zombies' weapons , power-ups, and soda machines.

Originating from Call of Duty: World at War, the Speed Cola machine also famously appeared in Call of Duty: Black Ops and its sequels , and is one of many different soda-themed upgrades players can acquire in the game. However, with Speed Cola giving the player increased reload speed, many players prioritize it after getting Juggernog, as it can help them survive several waves of undead foes.

While Treyarch's Call of Duty Zombies modes have continued the tradition of soda-themed upgrades in their zombies modes, newer games like Black Ops Cold War feature redesign machines to better suit the era that the game is set. Thus, many Call of Duty fans have a deep-rooted nostalgia for the original designs from World at War and the early Black Ops games .

In any case, having the materials and talent to create things from a favorite video game or other property is likely to make any devoted fan excited, since it's almost like having custom merchandise no one else owns. Of course, some users mentioned that they would love to have one of these mini perks should the user decide to sell them online, though whether that happens remains to be seen.

item.title: Minecraft Fan Reveals Awesome Mob Concept Based on the Game’s Squids
item.description:
Highlights

  • A gigantic squid and other concepts are part of a fanfiction project called Minecraft: Titans from artist BBMRedditAcc, with the squid in particular being far more creepy and memorable than the official Minecraft design.
  • The story of the fan's project revolves around modern-day builders discovering ancient land with huge mobs and ancient builders.
  • Teasers for future mobs include an Enderman Titan and Redstone Titans, with many of the ideas in the project inspired by fan theories about Minecraft lore.

MInecraft is full of quirky mobs and terrifying creatures as it is, but one fan is taking things a step further and reimagining some of them as titanic beasts, starting with the squid, which they gave a colossal makeover with their artwork. The art of the Minecraft mob depicts a giant, blocky squid with long, protruding tentacles and an elaborate elongated head resembling that of an octopus.

The "Squid Titan" is part of a series of concepts the artist is working on for a story called Minecraft : Titans , which is a fanfiction work of their own creation that reimagines some of the established concepts from the game. The artist seems to have a full-fledged storyline in the works, with multiple characters and a continuous plot based on their own interpretation of Minecraft 's lore and history.

Related
Minecraft Player Finds Item That Shouldn't Exist

A Minecraft player finds a valuable item during their adventures, but they are surprised to realize that their find has a rather unusual detail.

Reddit user BBMRedditAcc, the original artist, shared an image to the r/Minecraft community that depicts the Squid Titan alongside several other concepts and in-game Minecraft assets used as inspiration for their work. The post is allegedly the first of many to come, as the creator of the series announced plans to continue the series with more concept art as they finish them, though currently it is unknown when that may occur.

Player-Made Art Makes Minecraft Squids Much Scarier

It was here that the artist also revealed their Minecraft: Titans fanfiction project as well and provided some detailed information about the story, characters, and lore. While the specific plot details are still vague as of now, the story will reportedly revolve around a group of modern-day Minecraft builders stumbling upon an ancient land once inhabited by massive titans and "Ancient Builders" who worked the land to ruins.

They also teased a series of concepts that they plan to reveal in the future, such as the Enderman Titan, Redstone Titans and various others based on some of Minecraft's mobs, blocks and items. According to the artist's comments on the original post, the story is inspired heavily by fan theories about Minecraft that have circulated online for years, which have attempted to explain its history and lore in various ways.

Some fans even suggested the idea be made into an official Minecraft mod, which could be feasible with the right developers, since story-based maps and Minecraft mods have existed for years. In any case, there is still seemingly much more to come from the Minecraft : Titans project, and though it remains to be seen just how far it may go, the concept alone is certainly an ambitious one.

item.title: Bungie Offers Destiny 2 Players Advice On How to Prepare for The Final Shape
item.description:
Highlights

  • Bungie teases Ritual Pathfinder mechanic details while offering a warning to Destiny 2 players prepping for The Final Shape expansion.
  • Players are advised to prioritize their time and not hold onto Vanguard, Crucible, and Gambit bounties, which will be abandoned on June 4.
  • However, players looking to bounty prep still have alternative ways to gain an XP head start including vendors in different locations.

Bungie reveals new details about the upcoming Ritual Pathfinder mechanic and how it will impact vendor bounties and Destiny 2 players attempting to optimize their XP gain prior to the expansion's launch. With the Destiny 2 community feeling revitalized following Into The Light, Bungie has managed to keep that momentum going forward by revealing a constant stream of new details and information regarding The Final Shape expansion . A recent developer update gave fans a massive look at a lot of the new content coming in the expansion, from the new Dread enemy faction, the Pale Heart destination, and the highly customizable Prismatic subclass.

As with many expansions, players attempt to get a jumpstart on the leveling process for the seasonal artifact by stacking completed bounties so that when the new content arrives, they get a massive boost in XP. With The Final Shape approaching, the preparations have begun for most Destiny 2 players, especially since Bungie recently confirmed the new Power band pinnacle cap being set at 2000 and that the entire system and UI has been overhauled into a new adjusted Fireteam Power mechanic. However, for those prepping, Bungie provided a handy tip and warning for players utilizing bounties from the classic Tower vendors.

Related
Destiny 2 Reveals Prismatic Exotic Class Item Perks

Bungie confirms the perk combinations available when equipping the new exotic class items with the Destiny 2 prismatic subclass.

The Destiny 2 Team account posted a warning for players planning to hold onto Vanguard, Crucible, and Gambit bounties, which are going to be outright replaced by the Ritual Pathfinder mechanic. While Destiny 2 's new Pathfinder System was revealed last year , Bungie has announced that it plans to dive into more details in the coming weeks. The previous sneak peek showcased a branching tree system where players could earn more rewards by reaching certain nodes, advancing to a waiting engram at the end of the path. Considering this early look was made all the way back in August 2023, it's highly likely that the then in-progress UI has changed, though fans won't have to wait too much longer to see for themselves.

What Happens to Vendor Bounties when Destiny 2: The Final Shape Launches?

Still, this isn't the complete death knell for bounty prepping, as Bungie specifically calls out Vanguard, Crucible, and Gambit bounties. While those bounties will be abandoned on June 4, even if completed ahead of time, players still have alternative ways to gain a head start on their XP, including specific vendors like Eris Morn on the Moon, the Dreaming City with Petra, Neomuna, Europa, and many other locations. For those attempting to prepare for the launch of Destiny 2 : The Final Shape , there are still options, even if a few common ones have been minimized.

In the meantime, players have had the opportunity to complete their collection of deepsight weapons as Bungie made craftable weapons from the past four seasons much easier to obtain. Each day, Destiny 2 players can play a seasonal activity to earn Deepsight weapons . Better yet, the limited time bonus takes into account which weapons have yet to be obtained, giving fans a much better chance to earn the weapon they need on a daily basis.
